lines.content: This is an individual CS2103T greenfield Java project. It is forked from the project template Duke, which is named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Barbie.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
What can I do for you today?
* Implements the main Barbie chatbot logic.
* Main wrapper method for the command logic of Barbie chatbot.
int indexNumber = list.size(); // Starting from 1 reduces the need to subtract and add 1 for usability.
// No variables to edit, only output (refer to listTasks func)
break loop; // break out of the while loop, not switch statement
list.add(indexNumber, new Task(input)); // Create a new Task
System.out.println("\t Okey Dokey! I've added this task into your list:\n"
System.out.println("Hey Barbie,, make sure to give dates in the format YYYY-MM-DD alright! ");
* This class deals with all file reading and writing.
* Writes to the file given, in the format of [type][status] [desc].
* The status is always 0 when creating a new Task, so this method assumes
* that the task is marked as undone in this method.
* The type is also always Todo, as it takes in the "desc" parameter only.
* @param path the path of file to write to
* @param desc the description of the Task
protected static void addToList(Path path, String desc) {
* Writes to the file given, in the format of [type][status] [desc].
* The status is always 0 when creating a new Task, so this method assumes
* that the task is marked as undone in this method.
* The type is also always Deadline, as it takes in the "desc" and "deadline" parameter only.
* @param path the path of the file to write to
* @param desc the description of the Task
* @param deadline the deadline the task has to be completed by
protected static void addToList(Path path, String desc, LocalDate deadline) {
* Writes to the file given, in the format of [type][status] [desc].
* The status is always 0 when creating a new Task, so this method assumes
* that the task is marked as undone in this method.
* The type is also always Party, as it takes in the "desc", "from" and "to" parameter.
* @param path the path of the file to write to
* @param desc the description of the Task
* @param from the start time of the event
* @param to the end time of the event
public static void addToList(Path path, String desc, LocalDate from, LocalDate to) {
* Returns the latest list from the storage file upon starting up.
* @return the last list loaded from the storage file
System.out.println("[A new list created for current user]");
System.out.println("[A current list is being used for current user]");
* Changes the status of a Task in the storage file.
* @param path path of the storage file (to allow for saving to a specified list. See Level-7.1)
* @param status status to change the current Task to
* @param lineToChange the Task number to change
protected static void changeLineStatus(Path path, String status, int lineToChange) {
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid line number to change.");
* Deletes the line of the task from the list, and shifts the rest accordingly.
* @param path path of the storage file
* @param lineToDelete the Task number to delete
protected static void deleteLine(Path path, int lineToDelete) {
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid line number to delete.");
* Takes care of any of the UI related messages that will be displayed.
* Introduces the chatbot to the user.
* @param list list of Tasks that should be done today
+ "\n\nThis is the list of things you have today!");
System.out.println("\nWhat can I do for you?\n" + line);
* Greets the user before ending the chat.
* Prints that the Task has been successfully added.
* @param task Task that was added to the list
System.out.println("\tGot you barbie! I've added this task to your Barbie list:\n"
* Prints that the Task has been successfully marked as done.
* @param task Task that was marked as done
System.out.println("\t Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n"
* Prints that the Task has been successfully marked as undone.
* @param task Task that was marked as undone.
System.out.println("\t Alright! I've marked this task as not done yet:\n"
* Prints that the Task has been successfully deleted.
System.out.println("\t Deletion success! I've deleted this task off your list.");
* Prints a "[barbie]:" to signal that the chatbot is the one talking.
* Prints the Task in numerical order, or that there is no Task in the list.
* @param indexNumber size of list (for optimised performance)
protected static void listTasks(ArrayList<Task> list,int indexNumber) {
System.out.println("Hmm.. your list looks empty. To add items, use the 'todo', 'deadline' or 'party' commands!");
protected static void findTasks(ArrayList<Task> list, int indexNumber, String keyword) {
System.out.println("Hmm.. your list looks empty. To add items, use the 'todo', 'deadline' or 'party' commands!");
System.out.println("\tThese are your tasks with the keyword: " + keyword);
* Abstracts any helper functions that will be used in the main function.
* Retrieves the list of Tasks that should be done today.
* @param date date of the Tasks to retrieve
* @return the list of Tasks that should be done today
protected static ArrayList<Task> getDateList(LocalDate date, ArrayList<Task> lastList) {
* Parent class for all Barbie-related Exceptions.
* Constructor for a BarbieException for child classes to implement.
* Throws an exception for a Deadline initiated with no deadline.
super("Barbie your deadline has no deadline!\n"
+ "Remember to add a deadline after the description denoted by a '/' luv");
* Throws an exception for any Task initiated with no description.
super("Barbie your item has no description!\n"
+ "Remember to add a description after the command 'todo/deadline/party'.");
super("Hmm.. there didn't seem to be a keyword with that 'find' command, \nmake sure to find by typing 'find <keywaord>'!");
super("There seems to be no matching command for what you're asking.. these are the following commands you can use!\n\n"
* Throws an exception when no timing is given when initiating a Deadline or a Party.
super("Barbie your party has the incorrect number of timings!\n"
+ "Remember to add a 'start' time and an 'end' time"
+ " after the description! denote it by a '/' luv");
* Throws an exception when changing the status or deleting a Task.
super("Task to mark or unmark or del is not provided as a digit!\n"
+ "\n" + "use the list command to see the digit of your task and make sure to give \n"
+ "the digit of the task you want to mark/unmark/del. (e.g. mark 2)");
* Represents the subset of Tasks that have to be done by a certain deadline.
* Initialises an instance of a Deadline.
* @param description description of the Task to be completed
* @param by the deadline to complete the Task by in the format YYYY-MM-DD
* Checks if the Deadline is due on the specified date.
* @param date the date to compare the Deadline's deadline to in the format YYYY-MM-DD
* @return whether the Task is due on the given date or not
* Overrides the toString() method to return a customised String for each Deadline.
* @return String with "D" type and with a "[BY: xxx]" tag
* Represents the subset of Tasks that are events and have a start and end.
* Initialises an instance of a Party.
* @param from the start date of the Party
* @param to the end date of the Party
public Party(String description, LocalDate from, LocalDate to) {
* Checks if the Party is due on the specified date.
* @param date the date to compare the Party's deadline to in the format YYYY-MM-DD
* @return whether the Party is held on the given date or not
* Overrides the toString() method to return a customised String for each Todo.
* @return String with "P" type and with the "~from:xx, to:xx~" tag.
* Represents all Tasks that can be added into the list of Tasks saved by Barbie.
* Initialises a Task, that has not yet been completed.
* @param description description of the Task to be completed
* Retrieves the status of the Task: done or undone.
* @return a String of [X] or [ ], [X] for done and [ ] for undone.
* Meaning that the Task is marked as undone
* Overrides the toString() method to return a customised String with the status of the Task.
* @return customised String including the status and description of the Task
* Represents the subset of Tasks that only have a description.
* Initialises an instance of a Todo.
* @param description description of the Task to be completed
* Overrides the toString() method to return a customised String for each Todo.
private final ByteArrayOutputStream outputStreamCaptor = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
// For future use, currently /text-ui-test/runtest.sh is sufficient.
* Tests if the Storage::addToList is able to add a description with commas.
* Tests if the Storage::getLastList is able to return a task of description "do" for an incorrect input of do, work.
private final ByteArrayOutputStream outputStreamCaptor = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
* Tests if the intro to the chatbot is able to successfully print nothing for an empty list.
+ "\n\nThis is the list of things you have today!");

String question = ("
What can I do for you?
" + line + "
[you]:");
* Tests if an empty file list will print the prompt to add Tasks.
String expected = "Hmm.. your list looks empty. To add items, use the 'todo', 'deadline' or 'party' commands!";
* Tests if Utils::getDateList is able to return an empty list when the current list is empty.
